Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unallied.mmocraft.GameObject

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends Living
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains all information for a given player.
    Author:
    Faythless

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves everything about the Player to the database.

      • create

        public boolean create()
        Creates a new player in the database (INSERT).
        Returns:
        True if player was created; false if there was a problem (such as username already exists)

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft(int delta)
        Moves character to the left. Distance is determined by: (deltaTime) * (movementSpeed), where deltaTime is the difference in time between the last and current input poll (typically a single frame)
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in milliseconds since the last update

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight(int delta)
        Moves character to the right. Distance is determined by: (deltaTime) * (movementSpeed), where deltaTime is the difference in time between the last and current input poll (typically a single frame)
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in milliseconds since the last update

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp(int delta)
        Moves character up. Distance is determined by: (deltaTime) * (movementSpeed), where deltaTime is the difference in time between the last and current input poll (typically a single frame)
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in milliseconds since the last update

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(int delta)
        Moves character down. Distance is determined by: (deltaTime) * (movementSpeed), where deltaTime is the difference in time between the last and current input poll (typically a single frame)
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in milliseconds since the last update

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Retrieve the direction that the player is facing (left or right)
        Returns:
        direction

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Direction direction)
        Sets the direction that the player is facing (left or right).
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction the player should face

      • getDelay

        public int getDelay()
        Returns delay (in milliseconds) for each frame of animation. This value is increased based on the weight of the player's equipped shield.
        Returns:
        delay
